climbs.name: We Were Just Horny
climbs.fa: Blake Workman: May still be considered a "project"

content.location: Farthest right hand climb on the wall.

content.description: Sick, black rock with a Needles style attitude and Spearfish Canyon pump. Can be a bit mossy and moist. Bring lots of chalk and a toothbrush. Give the holds a good brushing and go for the send.
content.location: Left most route. Located right next to the tunnel's rusty door. Belayers might want to make sure they have an up to date tetanus shot.

content.description: Not just a one night stand or a casual hook-up. This is the premier two star, five-nine-plus for this area. Less mossy with more challenging holds this is a super-cool, slabby to vertical stimulating situation that will have you and your partner bumping uglies for many more minutes than you initially expected.
content.location: Second climb from the left. Pickup Sex shares the last bolt and anchors with the climb to its immediate right.

content.description: Get caught making out just to the right of a sick arete. A very footloose and fancy free climb on holds that will make you get quite close to the rock.
content.location: Third climb from the left. PDA shares the last bolt and anchors with the climb to its immediate left.

To the left of The Gift and slightly south of E-Harmoney dot com. 

  Caution! An unfinished route lies just to the left of this route. Don't get confused by the hanger placements, Norm's Route does trend a bit to the right.

content.protection: Bring at least 10 quickdraws and a personal anchor system. The anchors are new but might not be open.
content.location:
Easy to find, yet gives a nice secluded feeling. You and your lover can hold hands and walk on a gentle path all the way past the Wall of Wow, The Wall of Fabled Creatures, The Courthouse Wall and The Seepy Creepy Wall. After walking up the hill past the Creepy Seepy Wall you will come to a wide trail with a lot of green moss. Turn left and walk for about two minutes. You are heading towards a blonde wall with a wooden pipe and a hunk of rusty metal in front of it. 

  A wonderful place to have picnic and make love in the green grass. Norm's route is the route on the left and The Gift is the route to the right.

content.description: Easy fun handcrack to short pocketed face.
content.location: Handcrack on left wall when looking at the tunnel of love.

content.description: A friendly, not so secluded area, that is just enough off the beaten path where beginning climbers can get a taste for Spearfish Canyon climbing. This area contains two separate walls. The wall on the left is blonde rock that contains The Gift and Norm's route. These are two popular beginner routes that get sun in the early afternoon. The wall to the right consists of black, slabby rock which is home to some uber-classic two star lines. The black wall is located next to a tunnel that was blasted through the mountain in order to accommodate the infamous Homestake aqueduct system. This pipe system is made of a combination of wood, old-fashion terracotta and concrete. It's origins from the days of yore gives The Shadowlands a bit of historical significance and is guaranteed to be a source of fascination for anyone who has read a book or watched The History Channel. It might also be the reason the route names for the wall contain reference to laying pipe. With the innuendo aside, the combination of cool air blowing from the tunnel, and the fact that this wall never sees daylight, makes it a perfect afternoon retreat on scorching summer days.
